content.description: A century ago, the average height of adult women in the United States was 63 inches. Researchers believe that the average might be greater today. A random sample of 40 adult women was selected from the population. The sample had mean 64.2 inches and standard deviation 2.9 inches. Assuming all conditions for inference are met, the researchers will perform an appropriate hypothesis test to investigate their belief.
content.question: Which of the following is the correct test statistic for the hypothesis test?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals the fraction with numerator 63 minus 64.2, and denominator 2.9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>63</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>64.2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 63 minus 64.2, and denominator the fraction with numerator 2.9, and denominator the square root of 39" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>63</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>64.2</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>39</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 63 minus 64.2, and denominator the fraction with numerator 2.9, and denominator the square root of 40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>63</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>64.2</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 64.2 minus 63, and denominator the fraction with numerator 2.9, and denominator the square root of 39" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>64.2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>63</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>39</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 64.2 minus 63, and denominator the fraction with numerator 2.9, and denominator the square root of 40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>64.2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>63</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals the complex fraction with numerator 64.2 minus 63, and denominator the fraction with numerator 2.9, and denominator the square root of 40" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>64.2</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>63</mn></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.9</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
